meanings.definition: A small, often militant, political group.
meanings.sent1: The groupuscule gathered to discuss their plans for the protest.
meanings.sent2: The groupuscule of activists marched together for their cause.
meanings.sent3: The groupuscule decided to hold a bake sale to fund their political activities.
meanings.sent4: In the sea of opinions, their groupuscule stood out like a bright beacon.
meanings.sent5: The image of the groupuscule chanting slogans will forever be etched in my memory.

meanings.definition: A small, exclusive group or clique.
meanings.sent1: She was part of a groupuscule of friends who always sat together at lunch.
meanings.sent2: The groupuscule of artists met secretly to plan their next exhibition.
meanings.sent3: The groupuscule had a tradition of wearing matching hats to their meetings.
meanings.sent4: Their groupuscule was like a hidden gem in the bustling city.
meanings.sent5: The bond within the groupuscule was unbreakable, like a chain of steel.
